oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Producer/veterinarian perspective: Adding value to small ruminant dairies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mongini, Andrea
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sheep
goat
dairy
disease
economics
management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Commercial dairying has broadened my understanding of the key factors affecting small ruminant dairies beyond my veterinary background. Owning a sheep dairy and managing a goat dairy has allowed for insights into what it really takes to survive the hardships, failures, and successes related to milking sheep and goats. Certain trends are present in successful and failing dairies that are easy to find, once you know what to look for. In this talk, we will review the commonalities of successful and unsuccessful small ruminant dairies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 262-263
